titlestmt.titleproper: Register of the Alvin Kapusta collection
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Olga Dunlop

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2017-04-24T16:35-0700

change.item: Updated to add 3 photo envelopes to extent statement and photo file to locations (Sarah Patton).

Revised to update encoding and add unitid.
PUBLIC "-//Stanford University::Hoover Institution Archives//TEXT (US::CSt-H::::Alvin Kapusta collection)//EN" "reg_286.sgm" converted from EAD 1.0 to 2002 by v1to02.cdl.xsl (2004-09-16).

physdesc.extent: 36 manuscript boxes, 3 card file boxes, 3 envelopes

did.abstract: Clippings, photocopies of articles and pamphlets, photographs, notes, and bibliographies relating to Russian literature and art, especially in the emigration, and particularly to the writer Alekseĭ Remizov.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Alvin Kapusta collection, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1987.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This collection was assembled by Alvin Kapusta, a special assistant for Soviet nationalities in the U.S. State Department. He received his education at Minot State College and the University of California, Berkeley.

The collection consists of printed matter related to Russian and East European cultural and literary figures, to bibliographies of their work, and to bibliographical material in general. There is a detailed collection of printed matter related to the Russian author, Alekseĭ Remizov, including photocopies of his writings. Finally, there is a substantial amount of material dealing with the "Stundist" Movement in the Ukraine and the U.S., including accounts of religious persecution in the U.S.S.R.
The bulk of the collection covers the period from 1950-1980. The Alekseĭ Remizov material includes photocopies of books published from 1908-1955.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Bibliographical material related to Russia and Eastern Europe. Includes bibliographical guides, and guides to libraries, archives, and printing houses dealing with Russian and East European material.

did.unittitle: Librovich, S. F., Istoriia knigi v Rossii,
Slavic archives outside the Soviet Union, arranged by country
Library of Congress. Alexis Babine Collection, miscellaneous material including correspondence
Slavic books at the Library of Congress
Publishing houses in the West dealing with Russian material, arranged alphabetically

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes directories of periodicals, presses, and libraries both within the Soviet Union and in emigration.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note

scopecontent.p: Includes biographical material, interviews, and book reviews from periodical press.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Bibliographical and biographical material re Alekseĭ Remizov, photocopies and translations of his writings, critical works re Remizov, and miscellaneous material related to Alvin Kapusta's study of this writer.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes photocopies of correspondence, bibliographical, biographical, and critical material and writings by the author.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: General material related to Eastern Europe and the U.S.S.R., including history, religion, nationalism, and dissident movements.

scopecontent.p: Includes guides and directories.

scopecontent.p: Includes 4 prints of Voloshin, 2 of his wife, 1 of his father, and 1 of himself and his mother.
